intro: Iris caucasica var. major, commonly known as the Caucasian Iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It features tall, slender stems that bear showy, violet-blue to purple flowers with three upright petals and three recurved sepals. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–90 cm, with lance-shaped, grass-like leaves that are dark green and slightly hairy. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding vibrant color to gardens and natural landscapes.
